within.translation[0].definitions[0].def: before a certain period of time has passed
within.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: We should have the test results back within 24 hours.
He fell sick and died within a matter of weeks.
Within an hour of our arrival Caroline was starting to complain.
within.translation[0].definitions[1].def: during a certain period of time
within.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: the enormous success of televised sport within the last twenty years
Within the space of a year, three of the town’s factories have closed down.
within.translation[0].definitions[2].def: less than a certain distance from a particular place
within.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: The invading troops came within 50 miles of Paris.
Within a five mile radius of Ollerton there are several pubs and restaurants.
We live within easy reach of (=close to) the shops.
Adjust the driver’s seat so that all the controls are within reach (=close enough to touch).
As she came within sight of the house, she saw two men getting out of a car.
within.translation[0].definitions[3].def: inside a particular building or area
within.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: Prisoners who died were buried within the walls of the prison.
public footpaths within the national park
The rooms within were richly furnished.
Baby rabbits for sale. Enquire within.
within.translation[0].definitions[4].def: inside a society, organization, or group of people
within.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: There have been a lot of changes within the department since I joined.
an attempt to reform the system from within
within.translation[0].definitions[5].def: if something stays within a particular limit or set of rules, it does not go beyond that limit
within.translation[0].definitions[5].exa: We have to operate within a very tight budget.
Security firms have to work strictly within the law.
You can go anywhere you want within reason (=within reasonable limits).
within.translation[0].definitions[6].def: inside a person’s body or mind
within.translation[0].definitions[6].exa: Elaine felt a pain deep within her.
I’m feeling more relaxed within myself.
